file_content.text: I relent, I relent. You can have your Kaggath mark. Go on.
I need to know what Thanaton's plan is.
Tell me about your master.
What do you take me for?
A Lord knows better than to throw away his life.
A Sith.
I took you for a man, not a lackey to a haggard old Sith Lord with outmoded ideals.
An ambitious man.
You're right. Blast Thanaton.
We can do this the hard way or the easy way.
A fool. [Shock him.]
My quarrel isn't with you. Surely you don't want to die for Thanaton?
We don't need to be enemies.
I'd rather die for him than you. Unless you have a better offer?
Tell me what Thanaton's plan is, and I'll spare you.
His plans for your life.
Do you think I'm afraid to die? I am Sith. I fear nothing.
Thanaton certainly has you well-trained.
What an obedient slave.
Shut up. I am not Thanaton's dog.
If I help you, you have to promise you'll protect me from Thanaton.
If you fear nothing, then you simply haven't suffered enough.
Nonsense. [Shock him.]
You will come to fear me.
You'll learn. [Shock him.]
You have a choice: Follow me and I will raise you to Thanaton's old position, or follow Thanaton and die.
Let's make a deal.
Ah, now I'm interested. You should've said something earlier.
But I need your promise. If I agree to serve you, you'll protect me from Thanaton.
If you even think of betraying me, I'll have your head. Otherwise, you're safe.
Behave yourself and I will.
Don't worry about me.
Of course.
Ah, now I understand why you've been his apprentice all these years. Fear. So be it. You have my protection.
You're afraid of Thanaton?
My fear is the reason I'm still alive.
Why should I offer anything to scum like you?
You're right. [Shock him.]
Tell me your master's next move.
Thanaton's plan. [Shock him.]
Aaarrrgh.
Please, no more of that.
Moff Pyron's fleet is your best asset. Thanaton plans to destroy the fuel refinery so the fleet can't refuel. Without fuel, your fleet is useless.
The Empire needs those ships. Thanaton will be a traitor.
That's treason.
Destroying a Republic fuel refinery is hardly treachery, even if it leaves an Imperial fleet stranded.
All right. I'm curious.
Where does he plan to launch his attack?
Explain.
The Selonian tunnels. He's using them to enter the refinery and plant the bombs to destroy it.
Hurry. If you don't stop Thanaton, the fuel lines will be destroyed and your fleet will be stuck.
Enough of this. To your posts. Are you Imperials or dogs?
We will consume this galaxy in fire before this war is done. Fall behind and you will burn, too.
Lord Skar. What a pleasure to finally meet you.
Greetings.
Don't pretend on my account. We both know how this ends.
You have a most interesting way of inspiring your men.
That's a terrible pep talk.
Save your clever quips.
You're too late. I'm the fire, and I've come to consume you.
I love to watch things burn.
I can't believe Thanaton hasn't killed you yet.
Imperials. Attack this Sith. She is a traitor to the Empire.
Imperials. Attack this Sith. He is a traitor to the Empire.
Yes, my lord.
I have no wish to kill Imperial soldiers. This is between me and Skar's master.
Don't make me hurt you.
Don't listen to him! Attack!
Don't listen to her! Attack!
Forgive us, lord.
He's the traitor, not me.
[Force Persuade] Attack Skar.
Lord Skar's the traitor, not him!
Lord Skar's the traitor, not her!
Fight me yourself, you coward.
Don't hide behind your men.
Who said I wasn't going to?
You're pleased with yourself then. Leaving this base defenseless. It won't save you.
